speaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Sound Mixing for a Series or Special
text: Thomas J. Huth, Andre Caporaso, Robert Douglass, Dana Mark McClure   * * *  ## Transcript {Mike Lee}

speaker: Skyline
text: An Elevator rises to the top of the Space Needle.  _ACT ONE  Scene One -- Cafe Nervosa FADE IN  Niles and Martin are seated at a table.  Frasier enters in his squash togs._
prevSpeaker: Outstanding Multi-Camera Sound Mixing for a Series or Special

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, hello Dad, hi Niles.

speaker: Martin
text: Hey, Fras.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_to the counter waiter_] Uh, may I get my usual, please? [_notices Niles's suit_] Niles, we're playing squash in twenty minutes.  Where are your togs?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, yes, I had to hide them in my briefcase.  I told Daphne I was seeing patients all day.  It was the only way I could get out of driving her to this flower show.  It's two hours there and back.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see.  Well, we could have rescheduled.  Did you really have to lie?

speaker: Niles
text: Did I mention we'd be joined by Daphne's mother, who's suffering from some female complaint and can't get it through her head that I'm not a gynecologist?

speaker: Frasier
text: Ah.  Well, then you had to save yourself.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.  So, please, don't tell anyone we're playing squash today.  I can't have it getting back to Daphne.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right.

speaker: Roz
text: Hey, guys! [_they all ad-lib hellos_] I'm so glad you're here, you can meet my new boyfriend.  He's the hottest guy I've dated since...

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier... _He has noticed a man in a topcoat getting his coffee at the counter. Frasier turns to look and also becomes excited._

speaker: Roz
text: Okay, the hottest guy since... [_cracking up_] Frasier. [_laughs_]

speaker: Niles
text: That's Alistair Burke!

speaker: Frasier
text: I know!

speaker: Martin
text: Who's Alistair Burke?

speaker: Frasier
text: He is only the head of the Seattle Opera Guild, and one of the finest directors in the world.

speaker: Niles
text: His productions are brilliant.  He staged a Phillip Glass opera last year, and no one left. [_N.B. This would be the second time that Kelsey Grammer and Patrick Stewart have crossed paths -- the first being Grammer's cameo on _Star Trek: The Next Generation _as Captain Morgan Bateson in the episode, "Cause and Effect."  Grammer was the third actor from_ Cheers _to appear on a_ Star Trek _set, after Kirstie Alley in "Star Trek II: The Wrath of Khan" and Bebe Neuwirth in the_ Next Generation _episode "First Contact."  On the other hand, Stewart is the fourth actor from a_ Star Trek _series to appear on Frasier - the others being Robert Picardo from_ Voyager _in[[9.11]](/frasier/transcripts/season_9/episode_11/bully_for_martin.html "Bully for Martin") "Bully for Martin," Brent Spiner from _Next Generation _in[[10.13]](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_13/lilith_needs_a_favor.html "Lilith Needs A Favor")"Lilith Needs a Favor," and Nana Visitor from _Deep Space Nine _in[[10.14]](/frasier/transcripts/season_10/episode_14/daphne_does_dinner.html "Daphne Does Dinner")"Daphne Does Dinner."_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Alistair -- uh, it's, it's Frasier Crane.  Uh, we met last year at the fundraiser.

speaker: Alistair
text: [_shaking hands_] Of course!  You're on the radio.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes!

speaker: Alistair
text: [_to Niles_] And you're, uh -- don't tell me...

speaker: Alistair
text: All right, tell me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_deflated_] Niles Crane. [_also shakes hands_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, we've both got tickets to your premiere, and, oh, we can't wait to see what magic you'll work with "La Boheme."

speaker: Alistair
text: [_arch_] Well, I would be content if my Mimi would just lay off the cheeseburgers.  I sat her down yesterday and I said, "you're dying of consumption, dear, not over-consumption." _Frasier and Niles both give loud, suck-up laughs.  Martin and Roz share an eye-roll._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, that's hilarious!

speaker: Niles
text: It's funny because it's bitchy.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, and how well you're looking!

speaker: Alistair
text: Oh, thank you.

speaker: Niles
text: I like your suit!

speaker: Alistair
text: Well, you're too kind, and it's nice to see you again.  Bye- bye, take care.

speaker: Roz
text: Wow, that was thorough.  Find any polyps up there?

speaker: Frasier
text: We were merely paying due respect to one of the giants of the opera world. _Barry, Roz's new boyfriend, enters.  He is wearing jeans and a black t-shirt that shows off his physique to good effect._

speaker: Barry
text: Hey!

speaker: Roz
text: Barry, hi!  This is Frasier, and Niles, and Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: Hi -- whoa, strong handshake.  You look like you work out a lot.

speaker: Roz
text: He practically lives at the gym.

speaker: Barry
text: Well, it's my church.

speaker: Barry
text: Oh, this blouse looks amazing on you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, it's very chic, Roz.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, Barry picked it out.  He's the women's wear buyer at Bidwell's.  He spent a whole day last week going through my closet and throwing out all the stuff I shouldn't wear anymore.

speaker: Barry
text: You should have seen what she was still holding on to -- culottes!

speaker: Roz
text: Stop it!

speaker: Frasier
text: Well... one wonders what's been in Barry's closet a little too long. [_Niles sniggers_]

speaker: Martin
text: What are you talking about?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, come on, he didn't seem gay to you?

speaker: Martin
text: That guy's not gay!  You know how you can tell?  The muscles.

speaker: Niles
text: [_playing along_] Good point, Dad.  Second tip-off: no poodle.

speaker: Roz
text: So, isn't he fabulous?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, uh, fabulous sums it up in a word.

speaker: Martin
text: I think he's perfect for you, Roz -- good-looking, friendly, [_at Frasier_] and not gay at all.

speaker: Roz
text: Who said he was gay?

speaker: Martin
text: Not me.

speaker: Roz
text: He's not gay!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, Roz, but you can see how someone might get that impression, all right?

speaker: Roz
text: Why, because of his job?  Because he takes care of himself? That is just such lazy, stereotypical...

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, you're right, it was a shallow, knee-jerk assumption, and unworthy of us, both as psychiatrists and men about town.

speaker: Barry
text: We better go, we're gonna miss the movie.

speaker: Roz
text: Right, bye.

speaker: Martin
text: See you.

speaker: Roz
text: [_sees the tray_] What, no biscotti for you?

speaker: Barry
text: Please -- I'm a house. _They exit.  Frasier and Niles mouth at each other, "So gay."  FADE OUT  Scene Two -- Street It's evening, and Frasier and Niles are walking home together.  Niles is back in his suit, but Frasier is still in his squash togs, and his stride is extremely short. _

speaker: Niles
text: Can't you walk any faster?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm moving as fast as I can in these ridiculous shorts of yours.

speaker: Niles
text: Well, you wouldn't need them if you hadn't burst out of your own.

speaker: Frasier
text: I did not burst out of them.  My laundress simply over- bleached them until they had the tensile strength of a cobweb. If you're in such a hurry you should have brought your own car.

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne needed it for her flower show.  And remember...

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, you were seeing patients.  We did not play squash.

speaker: Niles
text: Is that Roz's boyfriend? _It is indeed Barry at the other end of the street, walking towards them.  Frasier and Niles turn toward each other in a huddle._

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, you don't suppose she told him what we were saying about him?

speaker: Frasier
text: No, I can't imagine she would do that.  Let's just act natural.

speaker: Niles
text: All right.

speaker: Frasier
text: Where did he go?

speaker: Niles
text: Odd.  He was just here. _Walking forward, they notice a set of stairs leading down, below a lit sign that says, "Bad Billy's."_

speaker: Niles
text: "Bad Billy's."  What sort of place do you think that is?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, let's see.  Tuesday is leather night... so it's probably some sort of shoe outlet. [_then_] It's a gay bar, you idiot. [_Niles mouths, "I know that"_] Come on, let's go.

speaker: Niles
text: What?!  No, no, no, no!  I told Daphne I was seeing patients until seven.  If I'm late, she might get suspicious.

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, Roz is my friend.  I'm not going to let her get hurt by some man who's lying to her about himself.  I'll be just a minute. _He heads down the stairs as Niles waits outside, uncomfortable.  CUT TO: Inside Bad Billy's Frasier enters.  Men of varying ages and attires are sat at tables or standing around -- but Frasier immediately stands out in his skimpy shorts.  He approaches a man at a table. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me, uh, I'm looking for a guy.

speaker: Patron
text: Yeah, I kinda got that from the shorts.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's a particular guy -- he's about thirty-five years old...

speaker: Eduardo
text: Frasier?

speaker: Frasier
text: Eduardo! [_to the patron_] My furniture polisher.  Don't tell me you put away paste and chamois for life as a barkeep.

speaker: Eduardo
text: I just do this on the side.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, bet you're surprised to see me in here.

speaker: Eduardo
text: [_going along_] Okay.

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, look, I thought I saw a friend of mine come in here.  He's, uh, mid-thirties, uh, wavy hair, good build...

speaker: Eduardo
text: Yeah, I think he's in the bathroom.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh... _He is unsure what to do next, when loud dance music blares.  Almost unconsciously, he starts moving to the beat.  He decides to wait._

speaker: Eduardo
text: Can I get you a drink?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_still moving to the music; "why not?"_] Sherry, please. _CUT TO: Street Niles is still waiting outside, when Barry emerges from the apartment building that they passed walking towards Bad Billy's after Barry vanished -- apparently that's where he was really going.  Mortified, Niles grabs a free magazine from a rack next to the stairway, opens it and holds it in front of his face.  As Barry walks past him, this is no impediment to identification. _

speaker: Barry
text: Oh, hi Niles.

speaker: Niles
text: Hey, Barry. _When Barry has passed, Niles really looks at the magazine's contents. Confused, he looks at the front cover and starts, realizing it is a gay adult contact magazine.  He hurriedly replaces it, grabs his briefcase and runs down the stairs.  CUT TO: Bad Billy's Frasier is sitting at the bar, sipping his sherry and bobbing to the music.  Niles comes in, very uncomfortable._

speaker: Niles
text: [_over the music_] Frasier, Barry's not here.  I just saw him.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_not hearing him_] What?

speaker: Niles
text: Barry's not here, let's go.

speaker: Frasier
text: He's in the bathroom.

speaker: Niles
text: No, he's not.  Can we just go, please?

speaker: Frasier
text: What did you say?

speaker: Niles
text: Daphne's expecting me, let's go!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come again?

speaker: Niles
text: [_yelling_] Oh, for God's sake...

speaker: Niles
text: I'm begging you, please take me home! _The brothers look around, acutely aware that everyone is looking at them with big grins._

speaker: Frasier
text: You see, actually, he and I are... _Another loud dance number starts up, drowning him out.  He gives up and heads for the door.  As he leaves, Eduardo grins and flashes him a thumbs-up.  Frasier smiles feebly and exits with Niles.  FADE TO:_ **THE DOCTOR IS OUT** _Scene Three -- KACL Frasier is doing his show. _

speaker: Frasier
text: You can rationalize your actions all you want to, Kevin, but the truth is, you're just not being honest, are you?

speaker: Kevin
text: [_v.o._] I guess I'm not, but it's not like you're so honest about everything in your life.

speaker: Frasier
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Kevin
text: Well, you've never told your audience you're gay.

speaker: Frasier
text: Excuse me?

speaker: Kevin
text: I saw you in a gay bar last night. _Roz, at first surprised, now looks mad -- she already suspects what this is about.  Frasier gives her an uncomfortable glance. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh.  Oh, I see. [_chuckling_] Yes, in fact, I did pop into Bad Billy's yesterday.  You see, I thought I had seen a gentlemen I wished to speak with go in there, and I'd certainly never been in that bar before.

speaker: Kevin
text: Then how come you knew the bartender by name?  And why were you wearing those tight little shorts?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, they-they were not my shorts.  You see, I'd been playing squash, and I borrowed them from my... [_catches himself_] uh, from my friend, who is slim-hipped.

speaker: Kevin
text: Yeah, kind of like that nervous guy you picked up.

speaker: Frasier
text: Look, I did not pick anybody up!  All right, I am going to put an end to this discussion, because there is nothing to discuss.  On my way home from the gym, I popped into Bad Billy's looking for a man I was hoping was in the bathroom.  I had a quick sherry with my French polisher and then I left. As for how I got into another man's shorts, that is no one's business! _Realizing what he has said and how it sounds, he is about to dig himself in deeper, but Roz cuts him off._

speaker: Roz
text: And we're off the air.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_throws off his headphones_] Oh, dear God!

speaker: Roz
text: That man you thought you saw going into Bad Billy's, that wouldn't be Barry, would it?

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Roz.  I-I saw him on the street, I turned, and the next thing I knew he was gone.  I thought he was...

speaker: Roz
text: Yeah, you know what Barry was doing from 10:00 until midnight last night?

speaker: Frasier
text: What?

speaker: Roz
text: Me, that's what!  He's not gay, whereas you, Miss Marple, you've just been outed.

speaker: Frasier
text: Outed?! _The door opens, and -- who else? -- Gil enters. _

speaker: Gil
text: Frasier!  I am so sorry, I thought that last call was appalling.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you, Gil.

speaker: Gil
text: You poor man!  How long you must have dreaded this dark, yet inevitable day.  I so wish you could have been allowed to come out in a time and manner of your own choosing, instead of being wrenched from your closet, your voice cracking, your cheeks crimson with shame...

speaker: Frasier
text: Gil, I am not gay. [_packs his briefcase_]

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, Frasier, you can't play coy once you've been caught traipsing about Bad Billy's in shorts that left little to the imagination.

speaker: Frasier
text: They were not my shorts!  I simply borrowed them because my own had split when I bent over...

speaker: Gil
text: Oh, please!  We don't need to know _everything_.  I just want to say that your KACL family will be here for you as you take your first brave steps on that yellow brick road to pride and self-acceptance and...

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, shut up, you big queen!

speaker: Gil
text: I see Kitty has claws. _As mad as she is, Roz is trying hard not to laugh.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Four -- Cafe Nervosa Frasier is sat at a table, having just finished his coffee.  A waitress brings him two biscotti on a plate and collects his empty cup. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, um, another latte to go, please. [_hands her some money_] And you can take it out of there, thank you. [_re: biscotti_] I-I didn't order these.

speaker: Waitress
text: They're from those guys over there. _She motions to two men seated at the counter.  They smile and wave at Frasier, which he feebly returns.  Martin enters, in a bleak mood._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Dad.  You care for a coffee?

speaker: Martin
text: Nah.  I can see where you might think I would, though.  A guy walks into a coffee bar, he can't blame people for thinking he likes coffee.

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: Course, uh, if he didn't like it, he could make that clear to people.  He might say, "I am not a coffee drinker"...

speaker: Martin
text: Or, "I have never tried coffee even once."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right, Dad.

speaker: Martin
text: "I am not even curious about..."

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, all right! [_the waitress brings his latte_] Thank you. _Martin trudges to the counter.  Niles comes in, with the now-familiar smug little grin on his face.  He sits with Frasier._

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier.

speaker: Frasier
text: I see you caught my show.

speaker: Niles
text: Mmm-hmm.

speaker: Frasier
text: Go ahead, let's hear it.

speaker: Niles
text: I'm not going to tease you.  I'm grateful.  You could have ratted me out to Daphne, but instead, you protected me... just like a big sister should. [_sniggers_]

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, I'm glad this tickles you.

speaker: Niles
text: I shouldn't make fun.  You people have been persecuted long enough as it is. [_sniggers again_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Are you done?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm done.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_rises_] I will return those shorts to you tomorrow.

speaker: Niles
text: No, keep them, you'll want them for the parade! [_laughs, then_] I'm done, now I'm done. _As Frasier is about to leave, and Martin comes back to the table with his coffee, Alistair emerges from the men's room._

speaker: Alistair
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Alistair.

speaker: Alistair
text: So sorry to hear about your ordeal today.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, boy -- you heard my show then?

speaker: Alistair
text: No, I heard the replay on "Kiki and Mel's Drivetime Circus." If it's any comfort, I went through the same thing myself once.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?

speaker: Alistair
text: Yes, I was a guest on a call-in show, and an angry ex- boyfriend phoned in.  Everything came out: names, dates, birthmarks.  Had quite a chat with the wife that night. Very frank... very expensive.  [_N.B. Ian McKellen's "outing" occurred in similar circumstances -- the actor was a guest on a call-in show, and when the discussion drifted to the subject of gay rights, one particularly conservative caller remarked, "why can't those people just stay in their clubs?"  McKellen lost his temper and shot back, "you mean like the Garrick Club?" (a very old, very conservative restaurant/men's club in London)  McKellen then revealed his orientation, adding that he wouldn't be caught dead in the Garrick._]

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how awful for you.  Of course, in my case-

speaker: Alistair
text: I know what might rally your spirits.  I'm giving a small party after the premiere of my opera next week.  Are you free to come?

speaker: Frasier
text: I'd be delighted!

speaker: Alistair
text: Splendid!  Well, I must get to rehearsals.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, how are things coming?

speaker: Alistair
text: You can tag along, see for yourself if you like. [_Niles gapes_]

speaker: Frasier
text: I would love that!  Let me just grab my coffee. [_runs back to his table and does_] Goodbye, Dad. [_smugly_] Niles. _He exits.  Niles turns around, apoplectic -- mouth gaping, knees wobbling. He sinks into his chair. _

speaker: Niles
text: Did you see that?  I would kill to go to that party! [_sulky_] I was at that gay bar too, you know.

speaker: Martin
text: Let's see... one of my sons just got picked up by a guy.  My other son is jealous. [_bites his biscotti_] Yep, life is good. _FADE TO:  Scene Five -- Apartment Martin is sitting in his chair, and Daphne is rolling up her exercise mat -- they have just finished Martin's exercises.  Niles is also there. Frasier enters, excited. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Dad, please clean up that debris around your chair.  Alistair is coming by.

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Alistair -- that's all we've heard around here all week. Alistair this, Alistair that...

speaker: Daphne
text: You can't blame him for being excited.  It's fun having a famous friend.  When I lived in England... do you know the actor Peter O'Toole?

speaker: Martin
text: [_interested_] Sure.

speaker: Daphne
text: I always thought it would be fun to be friends with him. _Martin sinks back down again -- what did he expect?  The doorbell rings. _

speaker: Frasier
text: Now, that's him.  Everyone just act natural.

speaker: Alistair
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: Alistair!

speaker: Alistair
text: You smell fantastic.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, it must be my new conditioner.  Sandalwood with just a hint of...?

speaker: Alistair
text: ...Cloves.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, the man's amazing.  He has the musical panache of Leonard Bernstein and the nose of a Tuscan truffle hog.

speaker: Alistair
text: You turn my head, sir.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, well, come and meet my father, Martin Crane.

speaker: Alistair
text: Well, how lovely to meet you, Martin.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shaking hands_] How are you?

speaker: Alistair
text: Niles...

speaker: Niles
text: Hello.

speaker: Alistair
text: Love the tie.

speaker: Niles
text: [_preening_] Charvet.

speaker: Daphne
text: And I'm Daphne, Niles' wife.

speaker: Alistair
text: [_disbelieving_] No.

speaker: Niles
text: We're expecting.

speaker: Alistair
text: Can't say I was.  How lovely to meet you, Daphne.

speaker: Daphne
text: Likewise.  [_N.B.  Again, Jane Leeves is very obviously pregnant by this time -- though unlike Season Eight, they're taking no trouble to conceal it._]

speaker: Alistair
text: Frasier, this apartment is stunning.

speaker: Frasier
text: Thank you.

speaker: Alistair
text: The view -- breathtaking; the art -- perfect; the chair -- hilarious.

speaker: Alistair
text: Damn.  So sorry.  I have to take this call. [_answers phone_] Hello?  Placido!

speaker: Frasier
text: Placido Domingo?!

speaker: Alistair
text: [_aside_] Yes. [_Niles also gapes; into phone_] I'm here with Frasier.  Yes, he's the one I told you about.  Oh, stop!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, oh, yes, uh... in the kitchen.

speaker: Alistair
text: [_heads into the kitchen; into phone_] Well, you'll meet him next month at the concert in Madrid. [_puts phone to shoulder_] Oops!  Now I've spoiled the surprise.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_ecstatic_] He's taking me to Madrid!

speaker: Martin
text: You just met him last week, what's going on?  He kissed you.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, he's a man of the theater, he kisses everyone.  Well, it's not like he's the first gay friend I've ever had.

speaker: Niles
text: He's the first one who thinks you're gay, too.

speaker: Frasier
text: He does not think I'm gay.

speaker: Niles
text: He thinks I'm gay, and I'm standing next to my pregnant wife.

speaker: Martin
text: Have you told him you're straight?

speaker: Frasier
text: I don't have to.  I mean, it's obvious -- we are just friends. [_crosses his arms_] He is not courting me.

speaker: Niles
text: [_notices_] Is that a new watch?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_drops his arms_] So what if it is!

speaker: Daphne
text: Jewelry!  Ooh, he's a keeper.

speaker: Frasier
text: Stop that!  My friendship with Alistair is the best thing that's happened to me in months.  I will not have you sully it by making it out to be something it's not.

speaker: Alistair
text: Sorry, my angel.  Well, we'd best get to that tailor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, yes, yes, we're having new tuxes made for Alistair's premiere party this weekend.

speaker: Alistair
text: To which you are all invited.

speaker: Niles
text: [_gasps_] Thank you! _As they leave, Alistair picks up a treat from a plate of small pastries that Frasier set out._

speaker: Daphne
text: Will Peter O'Toole be there?

speaker: Alistair
text: No, and he knows why. [_eats one_] These are amazing!  Where did you get them?

speaker: Frasier
text: I made them myself.

speaker: Alistair
text: No... is there anything this man can't do?

speaker: Niles
text: Time will tell. _Frasier and Alistair exit.  FADE TO:_ **THE QUEERNESS OF YOU** _Scene Six -- Alistair's Mansion It's late in the evening after Alistair's premiere, but the elegant party is in full swing in the grand ballroom of Alistair's home. A string quartet is playing.  Frasier and Niles, in tuxes, enter with Daphne, in an ample dress. Both brothers are dazzled by the attendance. _

speaker: Niles
text: Will you look at this crowd?  It's like a Who's Who of the cr�me de la cr�me of the upper crust!

speaker: Alistair
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_coming over_] Alistair, your production was a triumph!

speaker: Alistair
text: Wasn't it? [_then_] Smile. _He poses with Frasier for a photographer, huddling close to Frasier. This gives Frasier another frisson of uncertainty, but he forces it down._

speaker: Alistair
text: [_to Niles and Daphne_] Welcome, welcome.

speaker: Niles
text: Thank you.

speaker: Alistair
text: There are so many people here I'm dying for you to meet, but I have to make a little announcement first.  Glinka, darling, come and meet Frasier. _Frasier is overwhelmed again -- Glinka, a diva and the star of the show! _

speaker: Glinka
text: Frasier, finally!

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Glinka, it's such an honor to meet you.  I have all your recordings. [_kisses her hands_]

speaker: Glinka
text: So I hear that you and Alistair are quite an item.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, no, no, no, we're just very good friends.

speaker: Glinka
text: [_playing along_] Oh, yes.  Yes, of course.

speaker: Alistair
text: Everyone!  Could I have your attention, please?  I have to announce that our very own Nigel Frye is retiring and giving up his seat on the Opera board...

speaker: Alistair
text: But I am thrilled to name as his successor a tireless supporter of opera in Seattle, Dr. Frasier Crane. _For Frasier, that's the final triumph.  He gapes, trembling with ecstasy, as everyone oohs and aahs, applauding._

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh!  Oh, my!  Oh, I never dreamed... [_hugs Alistair_] Oh, thank you, thank you!

speaker: Alistair
text: [_between kisses on Frasier's cheeks_] Congratu...lations.

speaker: Glinka
text: [_aside to Niles and Daphne_] Stunning couple, aren't they?

speaker: Niles
text: I'm more stunned by them each day.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_hugs Daphne_] Oh, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: What an honor.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh my God!

speaker: Niles
text: Isn't it thrilling?  Frasier, can we talk to you for a moment?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes.

speaker: Niles
text: Do you realize that every person in this room thinks that you're Alistair's boyfriend?

speaker: Frasier
text: Listen, I can't help it if people think we're a couple.  The point is, I'm enjoying myself, and if you're too jealous to be happy for me, then that's your problem.

speaker: Niles
text: Jealous?!

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, that's right.  All my life, I have dreamed of being half of a power couple, and I finally am!  Is it perfect?  No.  But it's fun, and I don't want it to end.

speaker: Daphne
text: Don't you worry at all that Alistair might be falling for you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, please, the man has not even made a move on me.  And do you know why?  Because we are friends.  Famous, fabulous friends.

speaker: Niles
text: Oh, uh, Alistair.  Congratulations, it was a stunning production.

speaker: Alistair
text: Well, thank you, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: It must be awfully hard work putting on an opera.

speaker: Alistair
text: It is utterly draining.  In fact, when I'm in rehearsals, I devote every ounce of strength to it.  No exercising, no jogging, I even abstain from sex.  Well, you can ask Frasier here. [_caresses Frasier's chin_] My poor, dear, patient Frasier.

speaker: Glinka
text: [_comes over_] Care to dance?

speaker: Alistair
text: I would love to. [_caresses Frasier's chin again_] Don't go far.

speaker: Niles
text: [_smug again_] Well, looks like Nigel won't be the only one "giving up his seat" tonight.

speaker: Frasier
text: I could scratch your eyes out and not one person here would find it strange.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'm sorry.

speaker: Frasier
text: Damn my fatal allure.

speaker: Frasier
text: Alistair, when you're finished with this dance...

speaker: Glinka
text: [_charmed_] Oh no, be my guest. _She breaks away and allows Frasier to cut in.  Alistair and Frasier begin to waltz, Frasier very uncomfortable._

speaker: Alistair
text: Frasier, do you have any idea how sexy you look in that tux?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, I do.  Alistair, I'm afraid I may have given you the wrong impression about myself.

speaker: Alistair
text: You seem nervous.  Don't be.  And I want to thank you for waiting.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh no, the waiting was good, I enjoyed the waiting.

speaker: Alistair
text: Oh, me too! [_twirls Frasier_] How it sharpens the appetite. How it builds! [_dancing more against him_] The intensity, the heat, the desire!  Can you feel it?!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_literally, in terror_] Oh yes, there it is!

speaker: Frasier
text: Alistair, um... listen, I-I, I'm afraid I have to tell you something.  Uh... I'm not gay.

speaker: Alistair
text: Oh, Frasier, please don't tell me you're still struggling with those issues.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I-I like you so much, and I love our friendship.  I'm afraid we can never really be more than friends.

speaker: Alistair
text: Would three weeks on Capri in Bertolucci's villa change your mind?

speaker: Frasier
text: It's worth a try. [_then_] No, no, no.  It-it wouldn't. I'm sorry.

speaker: Alistair
text: [_sighs_] Well, then...

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm so sorry.

speaker: Alistair
text: So am I.  Could I ask a small favor of you?

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course, anything.

speaker: Alistair
text: Would you mind staying tonight until my other guests have gone?  I'd hate my friends to think I've been jilted.

speaker: Frasier
text: Of course.

speaker: Alistair
text: It won't be very late.  Around about 3:00 it's down to the core crowd, and we'll all relax and unwind. Servant: It's after midnight, sir.  Shall I fire up the hot tub?

speaker: Alistair
text: Absolutely.

speaker: Frasier
text: I'm afraid I don't have a bathing suit.

speaker: Alistair
text: Then you'll fit right in. _He drifts away into the crowd as Frasier starts to look panicked.  END OF ACT TWO_
